meanings.definition: The state or quality of being runny.
meanings.sent1: The runninesses of the melted ice cream made it easy to pour.
meanings.sent2: I prefer the runninesses of a soft-boiled egg over a hard-boiled one.
meanings.sent3: The runninesses of the paint made it look like a colorful waterfall.
meanings.sent4: Her tears flowed with the runninesses of a river after the sad movie.
meanings.sent5: The runninesses of the sauce added a delicious touch to the dish.

meanings.definition: The tendency to flow or drip easily.
meanings.sent1: The runninesses of the leaky faucet kept me up all night.
meanings.sent2: The runninesses of the honey made it perfect for drizzling over pancakes.
meanings.sent3: The runninesses of the gossip spread quickly through the office.
meanings.sent4: His words had the runninesses of honey, sweet and smooth.
meanings.sent5: The runninesses of the candle wax created a beautiful pattern as it dripped.

meanings.definition: The consistency of a liquid that is thin and watery.
meanings.sent1: The runninesses of the soup made it easy to slurp.
meanings.sent2: The runninesses of the juice made it refreshing on a hot day.
meanings.sent3: The runninesses of the spilled milk caused a slippery mess.
meanings.sent4: The runninesses of the rain made the streets glisten like silver.
meanings.sent5: The runninesses of the melted ice had a soothing effect on the sore throat.
